text: I don't even want to get into it with people, but having worked in SEN schools as a student occupational therapist and a disability sports coach for almost 10 years, I am very passionate about neurodiversity.

Some of the reactions to the little boy baking are truly saddening. Being ignorant to neurodiversity affects lives. The amount of kids I've assessed from mainstream coming in to SEN schools showed how quick adults were to mislabel children for behaviours beyond their control.

@AutieTaughtie I would like any teacher who has ever told a child/child's parent that said child is "smart but they just need to apply themselves" to find a competent neuropsychologist who's familiar with Neurodiversity and keep their business card on file for those instances.

INFOTWEET

Groups of people are neurodiverse.

Individuals are either neurotypical or neurodivergent.

Neurodiversity includes everyone.

Neurodivergency includes only neurodivergent people.

There are many neurodivergencies - eg. autism, dyslexia, ADHD.

@ADHD_Alien Tbh I think it's family-culture-related not even neurodiversity related. It depends on whether your upbringing shows empathy through relating shared experiences or through validating scripts. Kind of like how in some regions you ask after someone's job & in others their hobbies.

Hey fellow parents, we don't need the actually autistic hashtag the way autistic people do. Let's leave their space to them. We have *plenty* of others :
#autistic 
#Autism
#Neurodiversity
#NeurodiverseSquad
#AutismAwareness
We're supposed to be the ones with lots of imagination

text: At NOMADS United, we support neurodivergence.  Difference, not disability.  That doesn't mean many ND people aren't broken.  For many, it's trauma from the innumerable daily micro aggressions and abuses for challenging the status quo (via creativity).   #Neurodiversity
user_description:
About Our Mission: 
To support and unite individuals and organizations in friendship through action for the basic human rights of neurodivergents (ND) globally.

text: So what is the solution? (Part 2) Ask the neurodivergence camp (difference, not dysfunction) ... fix the system.  Lawyers, litigation, lobbying.  Whatever it takes to be recognized and validated as we are. #Neurodiversity
user_description:
About Our Mission:

text: So what is the solution? (Part 1) It's all about attribution.  Ask the medical deficit camp ... fix the broken person.  Drugs and cognitive therapies.  #Neurodiversity
user_description:
About Our Mission:

text: Opiods crises, homelessness, prison, and much more.  We are vastly over-represented in every languishing category of humanity.  Consider this statistic:  45% of the prison population are ADHD.  Mhhm.  The solution?  #Neurodiversity
user_description:
About Our Mission: 
To support and unite individuals and organizations in friendship through action for the basic human rights of neurodivergents (ND) globally.

text: In fact, most of the "successful" (esp history making) remain with a feeling of being outsiders and will tell you so in private conversation.  And for those who do not navigate the many, many barriers to opportunity ... well, life can be very bleak.  #Neurodiversity
user_description:
About Our Mission: 
To support and unite individuals and organizations in friendship through action for the basic human rights of neurodivergents (ND) globally.

text: For many NDs, our lived experience is that of an outsider.  We suffer in many ways, much of the time.  Social, economic and civic exclusion because we don't fit in the box of social order and replication. #Neurodiversity
user_description:
About Our Mission: 
To support and unite individuals and organizations in friendship through action for the basic human rights of neurodivergents (ND) globally.

text: Many may see us a pathological diagnosis, disorder or dysfunction.  A medical deficit.  This thinking has been entrenched throughout much of agrarian history.  #neurodiversity
user_description:
About Our Mission: 
To support and unite individuals and organizations in friendship through action for the basic human rights of neurodivergents (ND) globally.

text: More than this, we are also victims of systemic discrimination.  A term we are becoming more familiar with these days.  It was always there, just never revealed until dark days tested our humanity as a whole and silenced the noise around us.  #Neurodiversity
user_description:
About Our Mission:

text: Who are the neurodivergents (NDs)?  We are creators, explorers, visionaries, learners and empaths.  But to much of society and industry we are unwelcome troublemakers, as we are inclined to disrupt the status quo, entrenched priviledge and established power.  #Neurodiversity

a term that applied to me.
